answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Mark – I hope the following is helpful:
East Baton Rouge - 2006 - 2015 Library Capital Improvements Program
1.  East Baton Rouge Parish Library Strategic Plan, 2005 - 2015
2.  Capital Improvements Program (CIP) Assessment Study Presentation (PowerPoint Presentation - 40 MB), Oct. 19, 2006
3.  Answers to Questions Regarding CIP Assessment Study, Oct. 19, 2006
4.  CIP Assessment Study (Report - 37 MB), Nov. 3, 2006
5.  Metropolitan Council Presentation by Library Director David Farrar - Nov. 10, 2010
San Diego, CA – Library Matching Funds Program
http://sdcl.org/PDF/SDCL_matching-funds-program.pdf 
King County, WA – Your Investment. Your Library. Your Community: Capital Bond Improvement Projects
http://www.kcls.org/bond/ 
Kansas Statues – Public Libraries 
http://kansasstatutes.lesterama.org/Chapter_12/Article_12/12-1258.html 
PA – Eligible Matching Funds
http://www.pacode.com/secure/data/022/chapter142/s142.6.html 
New Ferndale Library Receives $1 Million in New Matching Funds
http://newferndalelibrary.org/new-ferndale-library-receives-1-million-in-new-matching-funds/ 
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text: Our County is considering allocating a portion of our county library funds specifically towards capital improvements for libraries.  We are looking at including a local match requirement of 25%.  We have five libraries in our county and are looking at issuing two awards a year.  I was wondering if anyone has experience with focusing funds to libraries specifically towards libraries.  Do you have suggestions on further leveraging these funds?  Thanks.
title: LIBRARY CAPITAL EXPENDITURES
